turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You've known me five years Elmer. When do you get to calling me David?

turns.speaker: ELMER
turns.text: Not my place, sir.  It would only be a matter of time before I'm calling you Dave.  Then where would we be?  By next year, you're my Sweety-Pie" and I'm "Coochie-Coo".  I'11 be back in 15.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You arrange those flowers yourself?

turns.speaker: ELMER
turns.text: Sure did.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They're pretty.  Learn it in the army?

turns.speaker: ELMER
turns.text: No - but when you've torn out a man's throat with your bare hands, you learn to appreciate the beautiful things in life.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hiya Dad ~ I'll need you upstairs for homework in about ....  oh, 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Great, good.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Who do you think is the ugliest guy who ever lived.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: He was incredible.  This guy is fearless.  He has no fear.

turns.text: Well, there is that ...

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I'11 give you a chance... Know anything about computers?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Hey, En, nice bike'- but remember: any kids you have are gonna look just like its handsome driver.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Jennifer!  This is not - repeat, not! how we do things in this family. I've told you never to get on one of those death traps!  Please - talk to me.  I promise to be reasonable.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Is Jenny gonna be okay?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: She was wearing a helmet.  It could have been worse.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: But is she gonna be okay?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How the hell should I know?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: ... in the distant future.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Bye, Bean.  Thanks for everything. And take care, huh?  I know it's insane, but I'm going to miss you.

turns.text: Okay.....

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: what a pleasure, Governor.  Welcome.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Hi, Grierson, forgive the war paint.  Going on To my regiment/s reunion after.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Not at all, Governor.  Very striking.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Interesting suit.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Why thank you sir.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: off the peg?

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: Yes it is ... may I introduce you To Bern ...

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I've known soldiers who've had their heads blown off who were more intelligent than you two.  Not only have you failed to protect your most valuable possession from theft - but you didn't even know it'd been stolen!  I'd sooner buy heroin from the guy who sells drugs outside my grandson's school than anything from you guys.

turns.speaker: GRIERSON
turns.text: I am sorry you feel that way.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: And I'm sorry you look that way, short-ass.  That suit stinks and you obviously dye your hair.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Shut up, Kevin.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: NO, seriously - I know he's your boyfriend, but there's something about his upper lip that is so weird.  What do you think it is, Dad?  Jen says it's a moustache, I say it's a cluster of about 11 mosquitoes, resting.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You know the thing I hate most about children?

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: KEVIN
turns.text: I wish I could use that at school.  "Hey, Teach, no hard feelings ... It's just things between us ain't what they used to be and I need a little space, ya know?  So I'11 see you around in a couple of years, maybe".

turns.text: We got nothing, Chief. We tore the place apart. We can only legally hold her for another couple of hours.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Dammit!  Where's that damn unit??!!

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Talk ta me, Bork.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Chief, we found a witness that says he saw two teenagers leaving Dallas' room shortly before we arrived.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Did you give him a full cavity search?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Ah, the witness?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Yes. You can never be too careful Bork.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Well sir, I didn't really think it was necessary. You see we have a picture of them from the elevator security cam. Here, have a look.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: They look like a couple of kids chief.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Bork, don't you realize what kids today are capable of? Don't you read the papers?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: You see what I see, Bork?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: I see it. I don't get it.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: You got half the state looking for ya - how do you get away?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Cut the power!

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Damn right. Bork, we're dealing with real pros here. My opinion, terrorists... What's the scoop on that stolen unit?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Well, sir it's not good.  Roll the tape... The X-5 unit is a new top-secret biological weapon, a manmade virus...

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Jesus Jumped-Up Christ! If this were to fall into the wrong hands...

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: It gets worse. The unit wasn't finished. It has a flaw - the casing. If hit hard enough, it could break open, releasing the virus.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Cavity search...?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Deep and hard.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Chief, you know that guy whose camper they were whacking off in?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Bork! You are a federal agent. You represent the United States Government... Never end a sentence with a preposition. Try again.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Oh, ah... You know that guy in whose camper they... I mean that guy off in whose camper they were whacking?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: That's better. Yes?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: We've run a sample through the National Criminal Sperm Bank and come up with two possible genetic matches for a father.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Well, I'll be a blue-nosed gopher.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Where did these guys come from?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: What the hell...? Bork! That bus we picked up. Where was it headin'?

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: D.C., Chief.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Jesus jumped-up... Bork, can you imagine what would happen if they set that thing off in our nation's capital, or even worse, if they sold it to some damned foreigner at that conference.  Well, it's not gonna happen!
